What Pat wrote:
----------------------------------------------------------------
Sunday, 5.17.09 I'm planning to hike Scar Ridge via the ski
trails on Loon Mountain. In terms of mileage and vertical gain
this hike is much tougher than the numbers indicate. It should
be smooth sailing up the Loon ski trails to the North Peak
(elevation 2900 feet). We'll proceed roughly 0.3 miles along a
backcountry ski trail and turn off as the trail continues
towards Black Mountain. From here it will be a tough 1.0 mile
bushwhack with a vertical gain of ~900 feet. This bushwhack is
notorious for the dense trees along the ridge.

In total the hike will encompass 6.0 miles with a vertical gain
of 2600 feet. I'd estimate the trip time to be roughly 6
hours. There are no views from the summit but there are nice
views north towards Franconia Ridge along the ski trail. It
won't be pretty, but peak #97 on the New England 100 highest is
not known for her beauty.

Let's start early in hopes the cooler night air will harden any
remaining snow, making our ascent as easy as possible. Meetup
time 8 am in the eastern end of the Loon parking lot.
Questions? Email me at pcushing21 at yahoo_dot_com

Hope you're game!

Pat
----------------------------------------------------------------
